TITLE: CNBC is bullish on XRP because it is targeting banks and cross-border payments
BODY: Wall Street media CNBC TV is calling XRP the standout crypto trade of 2026, saying its ahead of Bitcoin and Ether in recent market focus. During a segment after the bell last night, MacKenzie Sigalos, CNBC‚Äôs finance and techn correspondent, pointed out that the Ripple-backed token surged more than 20% in one week, overtook BNB, and became the third-largest crypto by market value, as Cryptopolitan previously reported. MacKenzie said XRP‚Äôs rally was not sudden, as the asset had outperformed quietly for months. Even on days when the crypto market was crashing, and it really was, she said it held steady. CNBC is bullish on XRP because it is targeting banks and cross-border payments MacKenzie said the main use case for XRP is payments, specifically cross-border settlement because Ripple designed the token to be a bridge asset. MacKenzie said the XRP pitch differs from Bitcoin‚Äôs digital gold story and stablecoins tokenized dollars story. MacKenzie said:- ‚ÄúXRP is trying to be the exchange layer that moves value between currencies. So money is moving into XRP for three big reasons. First, the regulatory overhang has finally cleared as Ripple has fully wrapped up its SEC fight as of August 2nd. It‚Äôs a less crowded trade than Bitcoin or Ether. And third, the flows have held up even during the Q4 dip. Investors kept adding to XRP-focused funds while Bitcoin ETF flows fell with the price.‚Äù Hosts asked how declines in Bitcoin and Ether fit into the trend, pointing to digital asset treasury companies and the risk of forced selling. But MacKenzie said that concern hangs over those assets. She said it makes sense that investors would look for an alternative inside crypto. MacKenzie also brought up an upcoming decision by MSCI, due in nine days, on whether names like Strategy remain in its indexes. She said that decision could lead to more selling tied to index rules. MacKenzie believes that XRP offers more upside partly because it starts from a lower base, linking that to activity seen late last year when spot Bitcoin ETFs saw net outflows in the fourth quarter and accumulation in XRP instantly picked up. CNBC says Solana is also a top performer aside from XRP MacKenzie then said interest has also grown around Solana, placing it alongside XRP as the two most-watched altcoins. She said Solana draws attention through tokenization, including money market funds, not just stablecoins. Earlier before Wall Street opened, Morgan Stanley announced that it filed an S-1 to launch Bitcoin and Solana ETFs. MacKenzie pointed out that the bank was the first to let advisors suggest spot Bitcoin ETFs and is now expanding product offerings. Since Bitcoin‚Äôs size limits percentage gains, faster blockchains allow easier handling of tokenized assets. The panel talked about transaction speed and cost as key factors, saying that Ether can offer cheaper transfers in some cases. They also mentioned that some stablecoin transfers on Coinbase‚Äôs Base network currently carry no fees. ‚ÄúFor now, many of those stablecoins are transaction free. So the speed is that what‚Äôs driving a lot of this, this idea that cost and speed is going to be the 3:11 defining factor for how people gravitate towards certain blockchains,‚Äù said¬†MacKenzie. Other blockchains like Tron were mentioned by the panelists as fast options with different pricing. MacKenzie explained that:- ‚ÄúBut at different costs, though. Different price points. Solana is a lot more cost‚Äëeffective than moving money over the Ethereum blockchain at certain times, which is why you‚Äôre seeing people diversify away from the big two.‚Äù MacKenzie pointed to Vlad Tenev at Robinhood discussing tokenized equities as well as Brian Armstrong of Coinbase and the company‚Äôs push beyond exchange trading. ‚ÄúBrian Armstrong is part of why the Coinbase trade is doing so well. Goldman Sachs upgrading it to a buy has to do with the fact that they‚Äôre diversifying away from just being a cryptocurrency exchange, and they‚Äôre getting into, like, ultimately more than just trading,‚Äù said MacKenzie. TITLE: Vanadi Bitcoin Pivot: Spanish Coffee Brand‚Äôs Audacious 173 BTC Treasury Reserve Revealed
BODY: BitcoinWorld Vanadi Bitcoin Pivot: Spanish Coffee Brand‚Äôs Audacious 173 BTC Treasury Reserve Revealed MADRID, SPAIN ‚Äì January 7, 2025 ‚Äì Spanish coffee company Vanadi Coffee has confirmed a substantial 173 Bitcoin treasury reserve, marking a definitive corporate pivot toward cryptocurrency. The announcement, made via the company‚Äôs official X account on January 6, 2025, validates last year‚Äôs ambitious $1.1 billion Bitcoin investment strategy. This strategic shift represents one of Europe‚Äôs most significant corporate transitions from traditional retail to digital asset management. Vanadi Bitcoin Strategy: From Coffee Beans to Digital Gold Vanadi Coffee‚Äôs corporate transformation began in late 2024 with a formal announcement about its Bitcoin-focused future. The company originally operated as a specialty coffee retailer across Spain. However, management decided to reallocate capital toward Bitcoin reserves. This decision followed extensive market analysis and board approval. Consequently, the company initiated a phased divestment from its coffee operations. The transition involved selling physical assets and inventory. Meanwhile, Vanadi began acquiring Bitcoin through regulated exchanges and over-the-counter desks. The company‚Äôs treasury now holds precisely 173 BTC, valued at approximately $11.8 million as of January 6, 2025. This represents the initial phase of their $1.1 billion allocation plan. Corporate Bitcoin adoption has accelerated globally since 2020. Major companies like MicroStrategy, Tesla, and Block have established substantial reserves. European corporations, however, have been more cautious in their approach. Vanadi‚Äôs announcement therefore signals a potential shift in regional corporate strategy. The move aligns with growing institutional acceptance of Bitcoin as a treasury reserve asset. Furthermore, it demonstrates confidence in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value proposition. Spanish regulatory frameworks have evolved to accommodate such corporate treasury management strategies. The Bank of Spain has issued guidelines for cryptocurrency holdings. Similarly, the National Securities Market Commission (CNMV) provides oversight for public companies. Financial Implications and Market Context Vanadi‚Äôs Bitcoin acquisition strategy involves dollar-cost averaging over several quarters. The company avoids market timing while accumulating during price corrections. This disciplined approach minimizes volatility impact on their balance sheet. Financial analysts note the accounting treatment differs from traditional assets. International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) require impairment testing for cryptocurrency holdings. However, U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) treat Bitcoin as an indefinite-lived intangible asset. Vanadi must therefore navigate complex reporting requirements across jurisdictions. Corporate Bitcoin Treasury Holdings Comparison (2025) Company Bitcoin Holdings Approximate Value Country MicroStrategy 226,331 BTC $15.4 billion United States Tesla 10,500 BTC $715 million United States Block 8,027 BTC $547 million United States Vanadi Coffee 173 BTC $11.8 million Spain Strategic Rationale Behind the Bitcoin Pivot Vanadi‚Äôs management team cites multiple factors driving their Bitcoin investment strategy. Primarily, they identify Bitcoin as a hedge against currency devaluation and inflation. The European Central Bank‚Äôs monetary policies have concerned many corporate treasurers. Additionally, Bitcoin‚Äôs finite supply contrasts with fiat currency systems. The cryptocurrency‚Äôs decentralized nature also appeals to companies seeking asset sovereignty. Vanadi specifically mentioned these advantages in their initial 2024 announcement. The company‚Äôs transition required shareholder approval through an extraordinary general meeting. Investors supported the strategy with an 82% majority vote. This demonstrates growing acceptance among traditional business stakeholders. The operational shift involves significant corporate restructuring. Vanadi will maintain minimal coffee operations during the transition period. However, the primary business focus now centers on Bitcoin acquisition and management. The company hired cryptocurrency custody specialists and treasury managers. They also established relationships with regulated custody providers. Security protocols include multi-signature wallets and cold storage solutions. Insurance coverage protects against theft and loss. These measures follow industry best practices for institutional Bitcoin management. Inflation Hedge: Bitcoin‚Äôs scarcity provides protection against currency devaluation Portfolio Diversification: Non-correlation with traditional assets reduces overall risk Technological Adoption: Positioning for future financial system evolution Shareholder Value: Potential for substantial capital appreciation over time European Corporate Adoption Trends Vanadi‚Äôs announcement coincides with increasing European corporate interest in Bitcoin. German companies have led regional adoption with favorable regulatory conditions. The German Banking Act now recognizes cryptocurrency as financial instruments. Similarly, Swiss corporations benefit from progressive cryptocurrency regulations. Spanish companies, however, have been slower to embrace Bitcoin treasury strategies. Vanadi therefore represents a pioneering example within Iberian business circles. Financial analysts predict other Spanish companies may follow this precedent. The tourism and export sectors show particular interest in cryptocurrency solutions. Regulatory Landscape and Compliance Considerations Spanish cryptocurrency regulations have evolved significantly since 2023. The government implemented the European Union‚Äôs Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulations ahead of schedule. These frameworks provide clarity for corporate cryptocurrency holdings. Companies must register with the Bank of Spain for anti-money laundering purposes. They must also implement know-your-customer procedures for all transactions. Tax treatment requires careful consideration of capital gains and losses. Vanadi works with specialized legal and accounting firms to ensure full compliance. The company files regular reports with Spanish financial authorities. This transparent approach builds trust with regulators and stakeholders. International standards continue developing for corporate cryptocurrency accounting. The International Accounting Standards Board monitors cryptocurrency reporting practices. Potential changes to accounting standards could affect how companies value Bitcoin holdings. Vanadi‚Äôs financial team stays informed about these developments. They participate in industry working groups on cryptocurrency accounting. The company also engages with Spanish banking institutions about cryptocurrency services. Several major Spanish banks now offer cryptocurrency custody for corporate clients. This infrastructure development supports broader corporate adoption. Market Reaction and Industry Analysis Financial markets responded positively to Vanadi‚Äôs Bitcoin reserve announcement. The company‚Äôs valuation increased approximately 15% following the revelation. Bitcoin‚Äôs price showed minimal reaction, indicating the purchase occurred over time. Cryptocurrency analysts note the psychological impact exceeds the financial magnitude. A traditional European company embracing Bitcoin signals mainstream acceptance. Industry observers compare Vanadi‚Äôs move to early corporate internet adoption. The strategic pivot demonstrates forward-thinking leadership according to market commentators. Competitor analysis reveals varied responses within the coffee industry. Major global coffee chains continue focusing on traditional expansion. However, some specialty coffee companies monitor cryptocurrency payment integration. Starbucks previously experimented with Bitcoin payments through the Bakkt platform. Other food and beverage companies test blockchain supply chain solutions. Vanadi‚Äôs complete business model transformation remains unique within the sector. The company essentially becomes a Bitcoin-focused investment vehicle with coffee heritage. Risk Management and Future Projections Vanadi acknowledges Bitcoin‚Äôs volatility presents management challenges. The company employs several risk mitigation strategies. These include gradual accumulation rather than lump-sum purchases. The treasury maintains substantial fiat reserves for operational needs. Hedging strategies using options and futures provide additional protection. The board reviews the Bitcoin strategy quarterly with risk assessment updates. External auditors verify holdings and security protocols annually. This comprehensive approach addresses stakeholder concerns about cryptocurrency risks. Future projections involve completing the $1.1 billion Bitcoin acquisition plan. The timeline extends through 2026 with periodic market updates. Vanadi may explore Bitcoin-related business opportunities beyond treasury management. Potential ventures include mining operations or financial services. The company monitors Bitcoin ecosystem developments for strategic partnerships. European cryptocurrency infrastructure improvements could accelerate their plans. Vanadi‚Äôs leadership remains committed to their Bitcoin-focused future despite market fluctuations. Conclusion Vanadi Coffee‚Äôs confirmation of 173 Bitcoin holdings validates their strategic pivot toward cryptocurrency. The Spanish company‚Äôs transformation from coffee retailer to Bitcoin-focused enterprise represents a significant corporate evolution. Their $1.1 billion investment plan demonstrates substantial commitment to Bitcoin as a treasury reserve asset. This development reflects broader trends in corporate cryptocurrency adoption, particularly within European markets. Vanadi‚Äôs approach combines disciplined accumulation with rigorous risk management and regulatory compliance. The company‚Äôs journey offers valuable insights for other businesses considering Bitcoin treasury strategies. As cryptocurrency integration accelerates globally, Vanadi‚Äôs Bitcoin reserve announcement positions them at the forefront of financial innovation. FAQs Q1: How much Bitcoin does Vanadi Coffee currently hold? Vanadi Coffee holds precisely 173 Bitcoin as confirmed in their January 6, 2025 announcement. This represents the initial phase of their $1.1 billion Bitcoin acquisition strategy. Q2: Why is a coffee company investing in Bitcoin? Vanadi is transitioning from coffee retail to become a Bitcoin-focused enterprise. Management views Bitcoin as a superior treasury reserve asset for inflation protection and potential appreciation. Q3: Is Vanadi completely abandoning its coffee business? The company maintains minimal coffee operations during transition but primarily focuses on Bitcoin acquisition and management as their core business strategy. Q4: How does Spanish regulation affect corporate Bitcoin holdings? Spain implements EU MiCA regulations requiring corporate registration with the Bank of Spain and compliance with anti-money laundering and know-your-customer procedures. Q5: What risks does Vanadi face with its Bitcoin strategy? Primary risks include Bitcoin price volatility, regulatory changes, security threats, and accounting complexities, which the company addresses through phased accumulation and comprehensive risk management. TITLE: Solana (SOL) Holds Support Post-Gains, Testing Bull Conviction
BODY: Solana started a fresh increase above the $135 zone. SOL price is now consolidating above $135 and might aim for more gains above the $140 zone. SOL price started a fresh upward move above the $135 and $138 levels against the US Dollar. The price is now trading above $135 and the 100-hourly simple moving average. There is a contracting triangle forming with support at $138 on the hourly chart of the SOL/USD pair (data source from Kraken). The pair could extend gains if it clears the $140 resistance zone. Solana Price Eyes Another Increase Solana price started a decent increase after it settled above the $130 zone, like Bitcoin and Ethereum . SOL climbed above the $135 level to enter a short-term positive zone. The price even smashed the $140 resistance. The bulls were able to push the price above $142. Recently, there were a couple of swing moves and the price dipped below the 50% Fib retracement level of the recent upward move from the $136 swing low to the $141 high. Solana is now trading above $138 and the 100-hourly simple moving average. Besides, there is a contracting triangle forming with support at $138 on the hourly chart of the SOL/USD pair. On the upside, the price is facing resistance near $140. The next major resistance is near the $142 level. The main resistance could be $145. A successful close above the $145 resistance zone could set the pace for another steady increase. The next key resistance is $150. Any more gains might send the price toward the $155 level. Downside Break In SOL? If SOL fails to rise above the $142 resistance, it could start another decline. Initial support on the downside is near the $138 zone, the trend line, and the 76.4% Fib retracement level of the recent upward move from the $136 swing low to the $141 high. The first major support is near the $136 level. A break below the $136 level might send the price toward the $130 support zone. If there is a close below the $130 support, the price could decline toward the $120 support in the near term. Technical Indicators Hourly MACD ‚Äì The MACD for SOL/USD is losing pace in the bullish zone. Hourly Hours RSI (Relative Strength Index) ‚Äì The RSI for SOL/USD is above the 50 level. Major Support Levels ‚Äì $138 and $136. Major Resistance Levels ‚Äì $140 and $142.

TITLE: Sigel makes raising AI capital look easy
BODY: Riot Platforms, a publicly traded Bitcoin mining company, sold nearly $200 million worth of Bitcoin in the last two months of 2025 to close the year with a balance of 18,005 BTC. Matthew Sigel, the head of digital asset research at VanEck, suggested that the proceeds from the BTC sales were just enough to kickstart Riot‚Äôs 2026-27 AI build-out. A snapshot report shared on social media by Sigel revealed that the company sold 383 BTC in November 2025 for approximately $37 million and 1,818 BTC in December for roughly $161.6 million, an 8% increase MoM. The total BTC sales over the two months amounted to approximately $198.6 million, which Sigel believes can cover the entire capital expenditure (capex) Riot has set aside for the first 112 MW data center build at Corsicana. Riot expects to complete the project in the first quarter of 2027. Sigel makes raising AI capital look easy The VanEck head of digital asset research made raising capital for AI build-out projects sound easy, teasing that just one winter of BTC sales is enough to fund phase 1 of Riot‚Äôs data center. Sigel previously stated that there is a connection between AI and Bitcoin, claiming that Bitcoin miners are among the largest sellers of BTC to fund their AI projects. According to Sigel, companies like Riot need to sell even more BTC to fund rising capex when credit conditions tighten. He noted that the BTC-Nasdaq correlation has increased over the past few months. Meanwhile, Riot produced 428 BTC in November 2025, representing an average of 14.3 BTC per day. The mining company also produced 460 BTC in December 2025 at an average of 14.8 BTC per day, which was an 8% increase MoM, and an 11% decrease YoY. The average net price per BTC sold was $96,560 in November and $88,870 in December. Jason Les, Riot‚Äôs CEO, said earlier this year that his company has made a strategic decision to sell its monthly BTC production to fund ongoing AI-focused growth and operations. He added that the move helps reduce Riot‚Äôs reliance on equity financing, limiting shareholder dilution. Riot expands deployed hashrate by 5% MoM In line with Riot‚Äôs strategic BTC production and sale to fund AI build-outs, the miner increased its deployed hashrate by 5% MoM, jumping slightly from 36.6 E+H/s in November to 38.5 E+H/s in December. The new hashrate also represented a 22% increase from 31.5 E+H/s in December 2024. The average operating hashrate in November was 34.6 E+H/s and 34.9 E+H/s in December 2025, representing a MoM increase of just 1%. Meanwhile, the average operating hashrate had increased by 27% YoY from December 2024‚Äôs 27.4 E+H/s. Riot also benefited from the surge in power and demand response credits. Power credits rose from just $1 million in November to $ 4.9 million in December, representing a 381% increase MoM. The power credits increased 549% YoY from December 2024‚Äôs $0.8 million. On the other hand, demand response credits remained almost the same MoM at $1.3 million (+2%). However, the YoY increase was a bit significant, rising 64% from $0.8 million in December 2024. Meanwhile, Riot‚Äôs total power credits also surged 171% MoM from $2.3 million in November to $6.2 million in December, and 301% YoY from $1.5 million in December 2024. The company‚Äôs all-in power cost declined by 1% MoM to 3.9 cents per KW/h (kilowatt hour). The YoY fleet efficiency also showed an improvement at 20.2 J/TH. TITLE: Bitcoin Price Prediction 2026-2030: Unveiling the Realistic Trajectory for BTC‚Äôs Remarkable Journey
BODY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Price Prediction 2026-2030: Unveiling the Realistic Trajectory for BTC‚Äôs Remarkable Journey As Bitcoin continues to dominate the cryptocurrency landscape in 2025, investors and analysts worldwide are examining the digital asset‚Äôs potential trajectory through the latter half of the decade. This comprehensive Bitcoin price prediction analysis explores the complex interplay of technological developments, regulatory frameworks, and macroeconomic factors that will likely influence BTC‚Äôs valuation from 2026 through 2030. Historical data from previous market cycles provides crucial context for understanding potential future movements, while current institutional adoption trends offer additional insight into Bitcoin‚Äôs evolving role within global finance. Bitcoin Price Prediction Methodology and Historical Context Professional analysts typically employ multiple methodologies when creating Bitcoin price predictions. These approaches include quantitative models based on historical volatility, network fundamentals analysis examining metrics like hash rate and active addresses, and comparative studies with traditional asset classes. The stock-to-flow model, while controversial, has gained attention for its previous correlation with Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements relative to its programmed scarcity. However, most experts emphasize that no single model can perfectly predict cryptocurrency markets, which remain influenced by unpredictable technological breakthroughs and regulatory developments. Historical context proves essential for understanding Bitcoin‚Äôs potential future. The cryptocurrency has experienced four-year cycles often correlated with its halving events, where mining rewards decrease by 50%. Previous cycles in 2012, 2016, and 2020 preceded significant price appreciation approximately 12-18 months following each halving. The 2024 halving event provides a reference point for analyzing the 2026-2030 period, though analysts caution that past performance never guarantees future results in such a rapidly evolving asset class. Key Factors Influencing Bitcoin‚Äôs 2026-2030 Valuation Several fundamental factors will likely determine Bitcoin‚Äôs price trajectory through the latter half of the decade. Institutional adoption represents perhaps the most significant variable, with major financial institutions increasingly integrating Bitcoin into investment products and treasury reserves. Regulatory clarity across major economies will either facilitate or hinder this institutional participation. Meanwhile, technological developments like the Lightning Network‚Äôs expansion and potential protocol upgrades could enhance Bitcoin‚Äôs utility and transaction efficiency. Macroeconomic Environment and Monetary Policy Impact Global monetary policy decisions will substantially influence Bitcoin‚Äôs valuation through 2030. Central bank actions regarding interest rates, quantitative easing programs, and currency debasement concerns often correlate with increased interest in decentralized assets. Historically, expansionary monetary policies have coincided with heightened cryptocurrency investment as investors seek inflation-resistant stores of value. The relationship between traditional financial markets and digital assets continues to evolve, with increasing correlation during periods of market stress potentially affecting Bitcoin‚Äôs diversification benefits. Demographic trends also favor long-term Bitcoin adoption. Younger generations show significantly higher cryptocurrency acceptance rates than older cohorts. As wealth transfers to these digitally-native populations accelerate through the decade, Bitcoin could experience sustained demand growth. Furthermore, developing nations with unstable national currencies continue exploring Bitcoin as both a transactional medium and value preservation tool, potentially creating new adoption vectors beyond speculative investment. Expert Analysis and Consensus Forecast Ranges Financial institutions and research firms have published varied Bitcoin price predictions for the 2026-2030 period. These forecasts typically range from conservative estimates of $100,000-$150,000 by 2030 to more optimistic projections exceeding $500,000. Major investment banks increasingly include cryptocurrency analysis in their annual outlook reports, though methodologies and assumptions differ significantly between firms. Independent analysts often emphasize Bitcoin‚Äôs network effects and Metcalfe‚Äôs Law, which suggests a network‚Äôs value increases proportionally to the square of its users. The table below summarizes selected institutional Bitcoin price predictions for 2030: Institution/Analyst 2030 Price Prediction Key Assumptions Standard Chartered $200,000 ETF inflows, reserve asset status ARK Invest $1,000,000+ Institutional allocation reaching 5% Bloomberg Intelligence $100,000-$150,000 Gradual adoption as digital gold Fidelity Digital Assets Not specified Network fundamentals improvement Notably, these predictions assume continued network security, absence of catastrophic regulatory actions in major economies, and no fundamental technological vulnerabilities emerging in Bitcoin‚Äôs protocol. Analysts universally emphasize the high volatility and uncertainty inherent in such long-term cryptocurrency forecasts. Technological Developments and Protocol Evolution Bitcoin‚Äôs underlying technology continues evolving through community-driven development. Several potential upgrades could significantly impact Bitcoin‚Äôs utility and valuation through 2030. The Lightning Network‚Äôs expansion enables faster, cheaper transactions, potentially increasing Bitcoin‚Äôs use for everyday payments. Taproot improvements enhance privacy and smart contract capabilities, while sidechain developments like Liquid Network facilitate faster settlements for institutional participants. Mining economics will undergo substantial changes through the decade. The 2028 halving event will reduce block rewards to 1.5625 BTC, potentially affecting miner profitability and network security if transaction fees don‚Äôt sufficiently compensate. Renewable energy integration in mining operations continues accelerating, potentially addressing environmental concerns that have limited institutional participation. Quantum computing developments represent both a potential threat to cryptographic security and an opportunity for protocol upgrades, with developers already researching quantum-resistant algorithms. Regulatory Landscape and Institutional Integration Regulatory clarity represents perhaps the most significant variable for Bitcoin‚Äôs 2026-2030 trajectory. Major economies continue developing comprehensive cryptocurrency frameworks, with outcomes ranging from supportive infrastructure development to restrictive measures. Clear regulations typically reduce uncertainty and facilitate institutional participation, while ambiguous or hostile regulatory environments can limit adoption and innovation. International coordination through organizations like the Financial Stability Board and International Monetary Fund will likely influence national approaches to cryptocurrency regulation. Institutional integration continues progressing across multiple sectors. Traditional finance increasingly offers Bitcoin-related products including: Exchange-traded funds (ETFs) providing regulated exposure Custody solutions from major financial institutions Payment integration by fintech companies Corporate treasury allocations as inflation hedges Retirement account options through specialized providers This institutional infrastructure development typically reduces volatility and increases market depth, potentially making Bitcoin more attractive to conservative investors through the latter half of the decade. Comparative Analysis with Traditional Assets Bitcoin‚Äôs evolving correlation with traditional assets provides insight into its potential role within diversified portfolios through 2030. Initially exhibiting near-zero correlation with stocks and bonds, Bitcoin has shown increasing correlation during periods of market stress, particularly following increased institutional participation. This changing relationship affects portfolio construction decisions and risk management approaches. Gold often serves as the most frequent comparison, with Bitcoin increasingly described as ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù due to its scarcity characteristics and potential inflation-hedging properties. Market capitalization comparisons offer perspective on Bitcoin‚Äôs growth potential. Surpassing $1 trillion in market capitalization during previous bull markets, Bitcoin remains significantly smaller than traditional asset classes like global equities ($100+ trillion) or bonds ($130+ trillion). Even modest allocation shifts from these massive markets could substantially impact Bitcoin‚Äôs valuation. However, critics note that valuation metrics for cryptocurrencies differ fundamentally from traditional assets, lacking conventional measures like cash flow or dividend yields that typically anchor traditional asset valuations. Conclusion Bitcoin price predictions for 2026 through 2030 involve numerous variables including technological developments, regulatory decisions, institutional adoption rates, and macroeconomic conditions. While optimistic projections suggest substantial appreciation potential, investors should approach long-term cryptocurrency forecasts with appropriate caution given the asset class‚Äôs volatility and evolving fundamentals. The Bitcoin price prediction landscape continues maturing as more traditional financial analysis frameworks apply to digital assets, yet unique characteristics of decentralized technologies require specialized understanding. Ultimately, Bitcoin‚Äôs trajectory through the latter half of the decade will likely depend on its continued evolution from speculative asset toward established financial infrastructure with clear utility and regulatory acceptance. FAQs Q1: What is the most reliable method for Bitcoin price prediction? No single method proves completely reliable for Bitcoin price prediction due to cryptocurrency market complexity. Most analysts combine multiple approaches including historical pattern analysis, network fundamentals examination, and macroeconomic factor assessment while acknowledging substantial uncertainty. Q2: How does Bitcoin‚Äôs halving cycle affect long-term price predictions? Bitcoin‚Äôs approximately four-year halving cycle reduces new supply issuance by 50%, historically correlating with subsequent price appreciation. However, analysts debate whether this relationship will persist as Bitcoin matures and other factors gain importance. Q3: What regulatory developments could most impact Bitcoin‚Äôs 2030 price? Clear regulatory frameworks in major economies like the United States and European Union could facilitate institutional participation, while restrictive measures or outright bans in significant markets could substantially limit adoption and valuation. Q4: How do institutional investments affect Bitcoin price predictions? Institutional participation typically increases market depth, reduces volatility, and establishes stronger price discovery mechanisms. Significant institutional allocation could support higher valuations but might also increase correlation with traditional markets. Q5: What technological risks could affect Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term valuation? Potential technological risks include quantum computing breakthroughs compromising cryptographic security, protocol vulnerabilities, scalability limitations, and competition from alternative cryptocurrencies with different technical approaches or governance models. This post Bitcoin Price Prediction 2026-2030: Unveiling the Realistic Trajectory for BTC‚Äôs Remarkable Journey first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

TITLE: Bitcoin ‚ÄòRecord‚Äô LTH Selling Inflated By Exchange Transfers, CryptoQuant Head Says
BODY: CryptoQuant‚Äôs head of research has highlighted how the recent high levels of Bitcoin HODLer selling were inflated by internal exchange moves. Recent Bitcoin Long-Term Holder Selling Hasn‚Äôt Been At True Record Levels In a new post on X, CryptoQuant head of research, Julio Moreno, has talked about the recent selloff from the Bitcoin long-term holders (LTHs) .¬†The LTHs refer to investors who have been holding onto their coins for a period longer than 155 days. Statistically, the longer an investor keeps their tokens dormant, the less likely they are to sell them at any point. As such, the LTHs with their long holding times are considered to include the resolute hands of the market that are unlikely to part with their coins. That said, there are times when these diamond hands do take to selling. One major such selloff occurred in November of this year, as the chart shared by Moreno shows. At the height of the Bitcoin LTH distribution in November, the 30-day sum of spending hit a record high of 1.55 million BTC. The analyst has pointed out, however, that this figure doesn‚Äôt tell the entire story. The value of the LTH distribution doesn‚Äôt exclude sources that don‚Äôt correspond to economic transactions. For example, internal wallet moves . It turns out that such transfers skewed the market picture notably this time around. ‚ÄúA significant portion of LTH spending was due to exchange internal transactions,‚Äù explained Moreno. According to CryptoQuant data, at least 0.65 million of the ‚ÄúHODLer selling‚Äù actually corresponded to internal wallet shuffling from cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase . Thus, the distribution from the group didn‚Äôt quite reach the levels that could be considered as new records. This wasn‚Äôt the first time that internal exchange transactions exaggerated LTH selling. As is visible in the chart, there was a sharp spike in Coinbase‚Äôs internal transfers of LTH-aged coins back in December 2018 as well. While adjusting for internal Coinbase shuffling lessens the scale of the latest diamond hand selloff, it doesn‚Äôt quite eliminate it. The monthly LTH spending still hit a notable level of 0.9 million BTC at the peak in November. The only time in the current cycle that the metric exceeded this mark was in December 2024. In fact, as the chart below displays, this selloff was the fifth highest on record. The record for the highest amount of Bitcoin LTH selling is still maintained by August 2017, which witnessed 1.4 million BTC in movements from the cohort. BTC Price At the time of writing, Bitcoin is floating around $93,800, up almost 7% in the last seven days.

TITLE: Solana Shatters Records: 2025 Annual Review Reveals New All-Time Highs In Key Metrics
BODY: Solana (SOL), one of the foremost blockchains in the cryptocurrency sector, recently released its annual review for 2025, showcasing major growth across several key metrics, including daily active wallets and decentralized exchange (DEX) volume. Seven Solana Apps Break $100 Million Revenue Barrier According to the report issued on social media platform X (previously Twitter) applications built on Solana generated $2.39 billion in revenue, reflecting a year-over-year increase of 46% and marking a new all-time high (ATH). Seven standout applications in particular, including Pumpfun, each surpassed the $100 million revenue threshold in 2025. Additionally, the variety of smaller applications‚Äîthose earning under $100 million‚Äîcollectively produced over $500 million in revenue. Related Reading: XRP Surges Towards $2.20: Leading Monday Gains And Driving Crypto ETF Inflows The network‚Äôs performance indicators are equally impressive. Solana achieved a revenue of $1.4 billion, demonstrating a 48-fold increase over the past two years. Non-vote transactions reached a new ATH of 33 billion, with a year-over-year growth of 28%. Furthermore, the network averaged 1,054 non-vote transactions per second (TPS) while unique active wallets averaged 3.2 million daily, marking a 50% increase year-on-year. In terms of wallet growth, Solana saw 725 million new wallets. Bitcoin Trading Volume Skyrockets To $33 Billion In terms of asset management, Solana‚Äôs stablecoin supply ended the year at $14.8 billion, more than doubling year-on-year. The blockchain facilitated a colossal $11.7 trillion in stablecoin transfers, marking a sevenfold increase over two years. Notably, equities made their debut on Solana in 2025, achieving a supply of $1 billion and trading volume of $651 million. Bitcoin trading volume grew fivefold compared to the previous year, reaching $33 billion and solidifying a new ATH. The total Bitcoin supply also doubled to $770 million. Staked SOL also saw an increase, with 421 million tokens staked, representing an 8% growth and another ATH. Additionally, the introduction of Solana ETFs attracted net inflows of $1.02 billion. SOL-Stablecoin Volume Soars To $782 Billion In the realm of decentralized exchanges, the total DEX volume reached $1.5 trillion, reflecting a 57% year-over-year growth and another all-time high for the network‚Äôs annual review. The trading volume for SOL-stablecoins set a record at $782 billion, more than doubling year-over-year. Twelve DEX platforms managed to process over $10 billion in volume, with Raydium leading the way at $347 billion. Furthermore, the artificial intelligence (AI) agent volume reached a new all-time high of $31 billion, along with tokenized asset volume rising to $598 million and project token volume increasing to $86 billion. Related Reading: Bitcoin Reaches $93,000 Amid Renewed Optimism: What To Keep An Eye On This Week In the sectors of memecoins and launchpads, memecoin volume totaled $482 billion, although this represented a slight decline of 10% year-on-year. Launchpads had a successful year as well, with six platforms generating over $1 billion in volume and launchpad revenue doubling year-on-year to $762 million. Trading platforms contributed significantly to Solana‚Äôs ecosystem, earning $940 million, a 44% increase compared to the prior year. Moreover, the trading volume processed by these platforms reached $108 billion, up 66% year-on-year. https://www.tradingview.com/x/dPrTZvZ9/ At the time of writing, SOL is trading at $138.50, having recovered by 10% over the past seven days. However, it is still trading 50% below its all-time high of $293, which was reached during last year‚Äôs rally. Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com

TITLE: Japanese Bond Yields Soar: Unprecedented BTC Volatility Looms in Global Markets
BODY: BitcoinWorld Japanese Bond Yields Soar: Unprecedented BTC Volatility Looms in Global Markets TOKYO, March 2025 ‚Äì Global financial markets face mounting pressure as Japanese government bond yields reach multi-year highs, creating potential turbulence for Bitcoin and cryptocurrency valuations worldwide. This significant development follows consecutive interest rate adjustments by the Bank of Japan, marking a historic shift in monetary policy that could fundamentally alter international capital flows. Market analysts now closely monitor how these rising yields might heighten BTC volatility through complex transmission mechanisms affecting global liquidity conditions. Understanding the Japanese Bond Yield Surge The Bank of Japan initiated its first interest rate hike cycle in over two decades during early 2024, fundamentally altering global financial dynamics. Consequently, yields on benchmark 10-year Japanese Government Bonds (JGBs) have climbed approximately 150 basis points since January, while 30-year bond yields have increased even more dramatically. This upward trajectory represents the most substantial yield movement in Japanese debt markets since the 2013 ‚ÄúAbenomics‚Äù volatility period. Several interconnected factors drive this yield surge. First, the Bank of Japan‚Äôs policy normalization reflects growing confidence in sustainable inflation after decades of deflationary pressure. Second, global inflationary trends have compelled central banks worldwide to adjust monetary policies. Third, Japan‚Äôs aging demographic profile creates structural pressures on government finances, influencing long-term yield expectations. These developments collectively reshape risk perceptions across international investment portfolios. The Yen Carry Trade Mechanism Explained For decades, the yen carry trade has served as a cornerstone of global market liquidity. This strategy involves borrowing Japanese yen at historically low interest rates, converting those funds into other currencies, and investing in higher-yielding assets worldwide. The substantial interest rate differential between Japan and other developed economies made this trade exceptionally profitable, particularly when Japanese rates remained near zero while other central banks maintained higher benchmark rates. The mechanics of this trade involve several key participants: Hedge funds seeking leveraged returns across multiple asset classes Global investment banks facilitating currency swaps and derivatives Institutional investors diversifying portfolios with international exposure Proprietary trading desks exploiting temporary market inefficiencies As Japanese yields rise, the fundamental economics of this trade deteriorate significantly. Higher borrowing costs reduce potential profits, while increased volatility raises risk premiums. Market participants must now reassess their positions, potentially triggering substantial capital reallocation across global markets. Historical Precedents and Market Reactions Financial historians recall similar episodes when Japanese monetary policy shifts created global market turbulence. The 2006-2007 unwinding of yen carry trades contributed to volatility preceding the global financial crisis. More recently, in late 2023, initial signals of Japanese monetary tightening preceded a 15% Bitcoin price correction within two weeks, demonstrating cryptocurrency‚Äôs sensitivity to these macroeconomic forces. Analysis of market data reveals consistent patterns. When Japanese yield differentials narrow by 50 basis points or more, cryptocurrency markets typically experience volatility spikes exceeding 30% above their 30-day averages. This correlation has strengthened as institutional cryptocurrency participation has grown, creating stronger linkages between traditional finance and digital asset markets. Transmission to Cryptocurrency Markets Bitcoin and major cryptocurrencies increasingly respond to traditional financial market signals as institutional adoption expands. The potential unwinding of yen carry trades could affect cryptocurrency markets through multiple transmission channels. First, reduced global liquidity might decrease available capital for speculative cryptocurrency investments. Second, risk aversion among institutional investors could prompt portfolio rebalancing away from volatile assets. Third, currency market volatility might increase hedging costs for international cryptocurrency traders. Market structure analysis reveals specific vulnerability points: Cryptocurrency Market Exposure to Yen Carry Trade Unwinding Transmission Channel Potential Impact Historical Evidence Liquidity Reduction Decreased trading volumes and increased bid-ask spreads 2018 cryptocurrency bear market correlation with quantitative tightening Risk Repricing Higher volatility premiums and reduced leverage availability March 2020 liquidity crisis affecting cryptocurrency margins Currency Effects Japanese yen strength reducing local cryptocurrency purchasing power 2015 Swiss franc unpegging and Bitcoin price movements Furthermore, cryptocurrency derivatives markets show particular sensitivity to these developments. Open interest in Bitcoin futures and options frequently correlates with global dollar liquidity measures, which themselves connect to yen funding conditions. Options pricing data already indicates rising volatility expectations among sophisticated market participants anticipating further Japanese monetary policy adjustments. Global Financial Market Interconnections The Japanese bond market‚Äôs influence extends far beyond Asia, creating ripple effects across multiple asset classes. European government bonds have shown increased correlation with Japanese yields since the policy shift began. Similarly, U.S. Treasury markets experience indirect pressure as international investors reassess relative value across developed market sovereign debt. These interconnected movements create complex feedback loops affecting all risk assets, including cryptocurrencies. Several key indicators merit close monitoring: USD/JPY exchange rate volatility as a proxy for carry trade dynamics Global dollar funding costs measured through cross-currency basis swaps Risk appetite indicators like the VIX and cryptocurrency fear/greed indexes Japanese investor portfolio flows into international assets Market participants report increasing correlation between these traditional financial indicators and cryptocurrency price movements. This developing relationship suggests cryptocurrency markets now integrate more fully into global capital allocation decisions, rather than operating as isolated speculative arenas. Expert Perspectives on Market Evolution Financial economists emphasize structural changes in market relationships. ‚ÄúThe traditional separation between cryptocurrency and traditional finance continues to erode,‚Äù notes Dr. Akiko Tanaka, Professor of International Finance at Tokyo University. ‚ÄúOur research shows cryptocurrency volatility now responds to global liquidity conditions with approximately 40% of the sensitivity observed in emerging market equities, representing a significant increase from just two years ago.‚Äù Market practitioners observe similar developments. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve adjusted our volatility models to incorporate Japanese yield movements as a secondary input,‚Äù explains Michael Chen, Head of Quantitative Strategy at Global Digital Assets Fund. ‚ÄúWhile the relationship isn‚Äôt perfectly linear, the directional impact has become statistically significant since 2023, particularly during periods of rapid monetary policy adjustment.‚Äù Potential Scenarios and Market Implications Financial analysts outline several plausible scenarios based on current market conditions. In a gradual adjustment scenario, Japanese yields continue rising moderately while the Bank of Japan provides clear forward guidance, potentially limiting cryptocurrency volatility to 20-30% above recent averages. Alternatively, a rapid unwinding scenario involving sudden capital repatriation could trigger cryptocurrency volatility spikes exceeding 50%, particularly if combined with broader risk-off sentiment in traditional markets. Market participants should consider several risk management strategies: Diversification across cryptocurrency sectors with different sensitivity profiles Dynamic position sizing based on volatility regime indicators Enhanced monitoring of traditional financial market signals Stress testing portfolios against various yield curve scenarios Regulatory developments add additional complexity. Japanese financial authorities continue developing cryptocurrency framework enhancements, potentially influencing market structure and participant behavior. International coordination through organizations like the Financial Stability Board and International Monetary Fund could further shape how cryptocurrency markets interact with traditional finance during periods of monetary policy transition. Conclusion The relationship between Japanese bond yields and BTC volatility represents a significant development in global financial market integration. As monetary policy normalization continues in Japan, cryptocurrency market participants must increasingly consider traditional financial indicators when assessing risk and opportunity. While historical patterns suggest potential volatility increases, the evolving market structure creates both challenges and opportunities for informed investors. Continued monitoring of Japanese monetary policy developments, combined with analysis of transmission mechanisms to cryptocurrency markets, remains essential for navigating this complex financial landscape in 2025 and beyond. FAQs Q1: What exactly is the yen carry trade and why does it matter for cryptocurrencies? The yen carry trade involves borrowing Japanese yen at low interest rates to invest in higher-yielding assets globally. This trade matters for cryptocurrencies because it affects global liquidity conditions. When the trade unwinds due to rising Japanese yields, it reduces available capital that might otherwise flow into speculative assets like Bitcoin, potentially heightening BTC volatility. Q2: How quickly could rising Japanese bond yields affect Bitcoin prices? Market reactions can occur within days or weeks, as demonstrated in late 2023 when Bitcoin experienced a 15% price drop following initial Japanese rate hike signals. The speed depends on how rapidly institutional investors adjust their global portfolios and whether the yield movements trigger broader risk aversion across financial markets. Q3: Are all cryptocurrencies equally affected by these macroeconomic developments? No, different cryptocurrencies show varying sensitivity. Bitcoin and Ethereum typically demonstrate stronger correlations with traditional financial indicators due to greater institutional ownership. Smaller altcoins may show less direct correlation but can experience amplified volatility during broader market stress periods. Q4: What indicators should investors watch to anticipate volatility changes? Key indicators include Japanese Government Bond yield movements, USD/JPY exchange rate volatility, global dollar funding costs through cross-currency basis swaps, and risk appetite measures like the VIX index. Additionally, monitoring Japanese investor portfolio flow data provides insights into capital allocation decisions. Q5: Could this situation create buying opportunities despite increased volatility? Historically, periods of heightened volatility have created both risks and opportunities. Disciplined investors might find attractive entry points during market overreactions, though careful risk management remains essential. The fundamental cryptocurrency adoption trajectory continues alongside these macroeconomic developments, creating potential long-term opportunities despite short-term volatility. This post Japanese Bond Yields Soar: Unprecedented BTC Volatility Looms in Global Markets first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

TITLE: Cango Inc. Announces December 2025 Bitcoin Production and Mining Operations Update
BODY: DALLAS, Jan. 5, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Cango Inc. (NYSE: CANG) ("Cango" or the "Company"), a leading Bitcoin miner leveraging its global operations to develop an integrated energy and AI compute platform, today published its Bitcoin production and mining operations update for December 2025. Note: Cango holds Bitcoin for the long term and does not currently intend to sell any of its Bitcoin holdings. Paul Yu, CEO and Director of Cango, commented, "Throughout 2025, Cango delivered strong and consistent operational growth. In December, due to favorable network difficulty adjustments, we maintained stable operating hashrate levels and achieved higher daily Bitcoin production, bringing our total Bitcoin holdings to 7,528.3 BTC. Additionally, in late December, a major shareholder decided to increase its investment in Cango with a US$10.5 million commitment, which expected to close in January 2026, representing a powerful vote of confidence in our strategic roadmap. This commitment will enable us to drive greater¬†Bitcoin mining efficiency, and accelerate the parallel development of our energy and AI compute platform in 2026." About¬†Cango Inc. Cango Inc. (NYSE: CANG) is a Bitcoin mining company with a vision to establish an integrated, global infrastructure platform capable of powering the future digital economy. The Company's mining operations span over 40 sites across North America, the Middle East, South America, and East Africa. Since entering the digital asset space in November 2024, Cango has activated pilot projects in both integrated energy solutions and distributed AI computing. In parallel, Cango continues to operate an online international used car export business through AutoCango.com. For more information, please visit: www.cangoonline.com . Investor Relations Contact Juliet Ye, Head of Communications Cango Inc. Email: ir@cangoonline.com Christensen Advisory Tel: +852 2117 0861 Email: cango@christensencomms.com Disclaimer: This is a sponsored press release and is for informational purposes only. It does not reflect the views of Bitzo, nor is it intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, or financial advice.

TITLE: Cango Inc. Announces December 2025 Bitcoin Production and Mining Operations Update
BODY: BitcoinWorld Cango Inc. Announces December 2025 Bitcoin Production and Mining Operations Update DALLAS, Jan. 5, 2026 /PRNewswire/ ‚Äì Cango Inc. (NYSE: CANG) (‚ÄúCango‚Äù or the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù), a leading Bitcoin miner leveraging its global operations to develop an integrated energy and AI compute platform, today published its Bitcoin production and mining operations update for December 2025. Note: Cango holds Bitcoin for the long term and does not currently intend to sell any of its Bitcoin holdings. Paul Yu, CEO and Director of Cango, commented, ‚ÄúThroughout 2025, Cango delivered strong and consistent operational growth. In December, due to favorable network difficulty adjustments, we maintained stable operating hashrate levels and achieved higher daily Bitcoin production, bringing our total Bitcoin holdings to 7,528.3 BTC. Additionally, in late December, a major shareholder decided to increase its investment in Cango with a US$10.5 million commitment, which expected to close in January 2026, representing a powerful vote of confidence in our strategic roadmap. This commitment will enable us to drive greater¬†Bitcoin mining efficiency, and accelerate the parallel development of our energy and AI compute platform in 2026.‚Äù About¬†Cango Inc. Cango Inc. (NYSE: CANG) is a Bitcoin mining company with a vision to establish an integrated, global infrastructure platform capable of powering the future digital economy. The Company‚Äôs mining operations span over 40 sites across North America, the Middle East, South America, and East Africa. Since entering the digital asset space in November 2024, Cango has activated pilot projects in both integrated energy solutions and distributed AI computing. In parallel, Cango continues to operate an online international used car export business through AutoCango.com. For more information, please visit: www.cangoonline.com . TITLE: Cango Inc. Announces December 2025 Bitcoin Production and Mining Operations Update
BODY: DALLAS, Jan. 5, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Cango Inc. (NYSE: CANG) ("Cango" or the "Company"), a leading Bitcoin miner leveraging its global operations to develop an integrated energy and AI compute platform, today published its Bitcoin production and mining operations update for December 2025. Note: Cango holds Bitcoin for the long term and does not currently intend to sell any of its Bitcoin holdings. Paul Yu, CEO and Director of Cango, commented, "Throughout 2025, Cango delivered strong and consistent operational growth. In December, due to favorable network difficulty adjustments, we maintained stable operating hashrate levels and achieved higher daily Bitcoin production, bringing our total Bitcoin holdings to 7,528.3 BTC. Additionally, in late December, a major shareholder decided to increase its investment in Cango with a US$10.5 million commitment, which expected to close in January 2026, representing a powerful vote of confidence in our strategic roadmap. This commitment will enable us to drive greater¬†Bitcoin mining efficiency, and accelerate the parallel development of our energy and AI compute platform in 2026." About¬†Cango Inc. Cango Inc. (NYSE: CANG) is a Bitcoin mining company with a vision to establish an integrated, global infrastructure platform capable of powering the future digital economy. The Company's mining operations span over 40 sites across North America, the Middle East, South America, and East Africa. Since entering the digital asset space in November 2024, Cango has activated pilot projects in both integrated energy solutions and distributed AI computing. In parallel, Cango continues to operate an online international used car export business through AutoCango.com. For more information, please visit: www.cangoonline.com . TITLE: Crypto adoption may rise as younger generations inherit wealth: Galaxy exec
BODY: Crypto mass adoption may be a matter of time as generational wealth shifts toward younger investors who are more open to digital assets, according to an executive at Galaxy Digital. The gradual transfer of wealth from older, more crypto-averse generations to younger, tech-savvy heirs could reshape investment preferences over the coming decades. Speaking on Tuesday during an episode of the Milk Road show, Zac Prince, head of Galaxy Digital‚Äôs banking venture Galaxy One, said the eventual redistribution of wealth could benefit the crypto industry. As assets move into the hands of younger generations, he argued, their investment preferences are likely to play a larger role in financial markets. ‚ÄúI see a lot of stuff about how like younger people are getting screwed because older people are holding all the money,‚Äù Prince said. He added that a wealth transfer will eventually begin, and when it does, ‚Äúthe preferences of younger folks are going to matter more.‚Äù Generational wealth transfer in focus The scale of the potential shift is significant. Investment bank UBS estimated in its 2025 global wealth report that Americans collectively hold around $163 trillion in wealth. Baby boomers ‚Äî those born between 1946 and 1964 ‚Äî account for more than half of that total, with $83.3 trillion in assets. As this wealth is gradually passed on, even a small reallocation toward alternative assets could have an outsized impact on markets such as crypto. While the process is likely to unfold over many years, industry participants see it as a structural tailwind rather than a short-term catalyst. Data suggests that younger investors already show greater willingness to hold crypto and other non-traditional assets. A fourth-quarter State of Crypto report from Coinbase found that about 25% of younger traders said they held assets such as crypto, derivatives, or private investments. That compares with just 8% among older investors. Technology and investment preferences Prince also pointed to younger generations‚Äô familiarity with technology as another factor that could support crypto adoption. He argued that modern trading platforms and financial apps align more closely with how younger investors prefer to manage their money. Newer tools often allow near-instant trading and access to multiple financial products through a single, intuitive interface. Prince contrasted this with more traditional models, where investors might need to call a broker or schedule a meeting with a financial adviser to execute trades. He said these technological trends favor digital-first asset classes such as crypto. This combination of technological comfort and shifting wealth could, over time, make crypto a more mainstream component of investment portfolios, particularly among younger demographics. Older investors show signs of interest While younger investors are more likely to hold crypto, some evidence suggests that older generations may also be warming to the asset class. A survey released in April last year by Australian exchange CoinSpot found that 38.5% of Australians aged over 60 said they were open to investing in crypto in the future. That figure was close to the national average of 37.8%. Additional data from the Australian exchange Independent Reserve also points to growing interest among older investors. Its 2024 survey found that crypto ownership among people aged over 65 tripled to 6% between 2019 and 2024. Taken together, these trends suggest that while generational change may be a key driver of long-term crypto adoption, openness to digital assets is gradually spreading across age groups. The post Crypto adoption may rise as younger generations inherit wealth: Galaxy exec appeared first on Invezz

TITLE: Bitcoin Whale Purchase: Stunning $280 Million Accumulation Signals Major Market Confidence
BODY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Whale Purchase: Stunning $280 Million Accumulation Signals Major Market Confidence In a stunning display of market conviction, a single cryptocurrency entity‚Äîcommonly known as a ‚Äòwhale‚Äô‚Äîexecuted a monumental purchase of 3,000 Bitcoin (BTC) valued at approximately $280 million. Blockchain analytics firm Lookonchain reported this significant transaction, which originated from three linked addresses just ten hours ago. This move immediately captured the attention of traders and analysts worldwide, prompting deep scrutiny of its timing and potential implications for Bitcoin‚Äôs price trajectory as we progress through 2025. Consequently, the market is now evaluating whether this signals a pivotal shift in sentiment among large-scale holders. Analyzing the $280 Million Bitcoin Whale Purchase Lookonchain, a respected on-chain intelligence platform, identified the coordinated activity. The firm‚Äôs analysis suggests three separate blockchain addresses, likely controlled by one entity, acquired a total of 3,000 BTC. Notably, the purchase occurred over a short period, indicating a deliberate accumulation strategy rather than gradual buying. Market data confirms the average purchase price hovered around $93,333 per Bitcoin, aligning with the prevailing market rate at the time of the transactions. Furthermore, such concentrated buying pressure from a single source can provide substantial support to the asset‚Äôs price floor, especially during periods of consolidation. To understand the scale, consider this comparison of recent notable whale accumulations: Date Entity/Report BTC Purchased Approx. Value (USD) Q4 2024 Institutional Fund A 1,200 BTC $110M January 2025 Corporate Treasury B 800 BTC $75M Today (Reported) Anonymous Whale 3,000 BTC $280M This transaction stands out for its sheer size and execution speed. Typically, whales employ sophisticated methods to mask their activity, but coordinated buys across linked addresses often leave a detectable pattern. Therefore, analysts use these patterns to gauge whale sentiment, a key on-chain metric. The Strategic Context of Major BTC Accumulation Understanding this purchase requires examining the broader market context. Bitcoin has recently experienced a period of relative stability following the heightened volatility associated with the 2024 halving event. Historically, accumulation by large holders often precedes significant price movements. Several strategic reasons could explain this whale‚Äôs actions: Long-Term Holding (HODLing): The whale may believe Bitcoin is fundamentally undervalued and is building a position for a multi-year horizon. Institutional Entry: The entity could be a proxy for an institutional investor entering the market discreetly. Portfolio Rebalancing: A large fund might be increasing its crypto allocation as a hedge against traditional market inflation. Market Sentiment Signal: Such a public move can itself influence market psychology, encouraging other investors to buy. Moreover, the purchase occurred without triggering major price spikes, suggesting the whale used over-the-counter (OTC) desks or carefully split orders across exchanges. This method minimizes market impact and demonstrates sophisticated execution. Ultimately, the timing aligns with a period where macroeconomic uncertainty persists, reinforcing Bitcoin‚Äôs narrative as ‚Äòdigital gold.‚Äô Expert Insights on Whale Behavior and Market Impact Leading cryptocurrency analysts emphasize the importance of whale movements. ‚ÄúWhale accumulation at this scale is a strong confidence indicator,‚Äù notes a veteran market strategist from a top blockchain analytics firm. ‚ÄúWe monitor these flows closely because they often represent ‚Äòsmart money‚Äô positioning ahead of major catalysts. The lack of subsequent selling pressure is equally crucial.‚Äù Evidence from past cycles supports this view. For instance, sustained whale accumulation in late 2020 preceded the bull run of 2021. Key metrics analysts now watch include: Exchange Netflow: Whether the BTC moved to private custody (bullish) or to exchanges for potential selling (bearish). Wallet Age Bands: Monitoring if old whales are distributing or new whales are forming. Realized Price: The average price at which the acquired coins last moved, indicating profit/loss thresholds. Initial data suggests this whale moved the purchased BTC into deep cold storage, a strongly bullish signal for long-term holding intent. Consequently, the market often interprets such custody moves as a reduction in immediate sell-side pressure. Potential Implications for the 2025 Cryptocurrency Market This $280 million purchase carries several potential implications for Bitcoin and the broader digital asset market. First, it provides a substantial volume-based support level near the $93,000 price point. If the whale holds, this zone could become a strong defense against downward price movements. Second, it may inspire other large-scale investors to evaluate their own positions, potentially leading to follow-on accumulation. The transaction also highlights the growing maturity of market infrastructure. The ability to execute a trade of this size efficiently points to improved liquidity and advanced trading tools available to major players. However, it also underscores the concentration of Bitcoin wealth, a perennial topic of discussion regarding network decentralization. Regardless, the immediate effect has been a noticeable shift in trader sentiment on social and derivatives platforms, with funding rates and fear/greed indices adjusting positively. Conclusion The stunning $280 million Bitcoin whale purchase of 3,000 BTC represents a significant event in the 2025 cryptocurrency landscape. This transaction, meticulously tracked by on-chain analysts, demonstrates profound confidence from a major market participant at a critical juncture. While the identity of the whale remains unknown, the action‚Äôs scale, timing, and execution speak volumes. It reinforces Bitcoin‚Äôs role as a strategic asset for large portfolios and provides a tangible data point for bullish market thesis. Moving forward, the market will closely watch for any distribution from this address, as its holding behavior will remain a key barometer of high-net-worth investor sentiment toward Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value proposition. FAQs Q1: What is a ‚ÄòBitcoin whale‚Äô? A Bitcoin whale is an individual or entity that holds a sufficiently large amount of Bitcoin to potentially influence the market‚Äôs price through their trades. There is no official threshold, but addresses holding over 1,000 BTC are generally considered whales. Q2: How do analysts know the three addresses belong to the same whale? Blockchain analysts use heuristic clustering. They examine patterns like funding sources (common input ownership), simultaneous transaction timing, and behavioral fingerprints. If multiple addresses receive funds from the same source or act in unison repeatedly, they are likely controlled by a single entity. Q3: Does a large whale purchase guarantee the Bitcoin price will rise? Not necessarily. While it indicates strong buying pressure and confidence, price is influenced by many factors including broader macroeconomics, regulatory news, and overall market sentiment. However, large accumulations historically correlate with stronger long-term price foundations. Q4: What is the difference between an OTC trade and an exchange trade for a whale? An over-the-counter (OTC) trade is a private, bilateral agreement to buy/sell large amounts directly, often at a negotiated price. It avoids moving the public market price. An exchange trade executes orders on a public order book, which can cause significant price slippage and visibility for large orders. Q5: Why is moving BTC to ‚Äòcold storage‚Äô considered a bullish signal? Moving BTC to a cold storage wallet (an offline device) signals an intent to hold the asset long-term, removing it from immediate circulation on exchanges where it could be sold. This reduces the readily available supply on the market, which is a fundamentally bullish dynamic if demand remains constant or increases. This post Bitcoin Whale Purchase: Stunning $280 Million Accumulation Signals Major Market Confidence first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

TITLE: Ripple‚Äôs XRP Rejected at $2.40, Bitcoin (BTC) Volatility Roars Back: Market Watch
BODY: Bitcoin‚Äôs price actions became significantly more volatile yesterday when the asset neared $95,000 only to be rejected and driven south by several grand before staging a comeback. Several altcoins have posted some gains over the past day, including ETH, which has risen to $3,250, and BNB, which has tapped $920. BTC Goes Up and Down and Up The start of the year brought some gains for the bulls as the primary cryptocurrency quickly erased some of the late December 2025 losses and reclaimed the $90,000 level on Friday. It reaffirmed its position above that line during the weekend, as even the attacks from the United States against Venezuela couldn‚Äôt shake it up for long. The business week began with another rally that pushed bitcoin to $93,000 by late Monday. Hours later, the cryptocurrency tapped a multi-week peak of almost $95,000 as the bulls seemed in complete control. However, that changed throughout the trading day, and BTC slumped below $91,500 at one point after another rejection at $94,500. More volatility ensued, with bitcoin jumping to $93,800, where it was stopped and now sits just inches below $93,000. Its market capitalization, though, has returned to $1.850 trillion. Its dominance over the altcoins has declined by over 1% in the past few weeks to 56.5% on CG. BTCUSD Jan 7. Source: TradingView XRP Rejected, RAIN Pumps Ripple‚Äôs cross-border token was among the top performers yesterday, having surged by double digits to a multi-month peak at just over $2.40 at one point. However, it was also stopped there and slipped to $2.20 before it found some relief at $2.28 as of now. ZEC, XLM, and SIU are also slightly in the red from the other larger-cap alts. In contrast, ETH has jumped to $2,500 after a 1% daily increase, while BNB is close to $920. SOL has tapped $140, while XMR is above $455. RAIN and M have marked the biggest gains over the past 24 hours. The total crypto market cap has lost around $25 billion since this time yesterday and is down to $3.275 trillion on CG. Cryptocurrency Market Overview January 7. Source: QuantifyCrypto The post Ripple‚Äôs XRP Rejected at $2.40, Bitcoin (BTC) Volatility Roars Back: Market Watch appeared first on CryptoPotato .

TITLE: Bitcoin Funding Rates Improve, But Signal Still Not Decisive: Glassnode
BODY: Analytics firm Glassnode has highlighted how the Bitcoin Funding Rates have increased across the various exchanges, but still not to a high degree. Bitcoin Perps Funding Rates Have Surged In a new post on X, Glassnode has talked about the latest trend in the Bitcoin Funding Rates for the major perpetual futures markets. The ‚ÄúFunding Rate‚Äù is an indicator that measures the amount of periodic fees that traders on the futures market are exchanging between each other on a given derivatives platform. Related Reading: Bitcoin Accumulation: Data Shows Institutions Are Net Buyers Again When the value of this metric is positive, it means the long holders are paying a premium to the shorts in order to hold onto their position. Such a trend implies a bullish mentality is dominant in the market. On the other hand, the indicator being below the zero mark suggests the shorts outweigh the longs and a bearish sentiment is shared by the majority of traders on the exchange. Now, here is the chart shared by Glassnode that shows the trend in the 7-day moving average (MA) of the Bitcoin Funding Rate for major exchanges over the last couple of years: As displayed in the above graph, the Bitcoin Funding Rate has witnessed an increase across these platforms recently, indicating that investors have been setting up fresh bullish positions. The mean Funding Rate for these exchanges dropped to the 0% mark back in November as the cryptocurrency‚Äôs price went through a crash. As the asset settled into its consolidation phase, investors gradually set up longs, culminating in the indicator recovering to 0.005%. Related Reading: Bitcoin Miner Capitulation Ends: Hash Ribbons Flash Buy Signal In the last 24 hours, however, the mean Funding Rate has retraced back to 0.003%, implying some investors have closed up their long positions after the latest recovery rally and/or others have set up shorts to bet against the bullish price action. In the past, major rallies have tended to occur alongside notable positive Funding Rates on the different exchanges. According to Glassnode, the threshold has generally lied at 0.001%. Since the mean Funding Rate is still below this level, the analytics firm has noted, ‚Äúcurrent conditions remain supportive but not yet decisive.‚Äù BTC Broke Above $94,000 Before Retracing Down Bitcoin has seen the renewal of bullish momentum recently, with its price recovering as high as $94,700, but the past day has seen a setback for the digital asset as it‚Äôs now back at $92,100. Other cryptocurrencies have also been volatile to varying degrees in the past day, which has resulted in liquidations of over $500 million on the derivatives exchanges, as data from CoinGlass shows. Out of these $503 million in liquidations, about $146 million of the positions involved were Bitcoin-related ones. Featured image from Dall-E, CoinGlass.com, Glassnode.com, chart from TradingView.com
